I'm using Aurora. When I'm on my Gmail tab everything looks normal.  When I switch to another tab or application and then switch back to my gmail tab, the background color of my gmail theme (blue) comes to the foreground and it shows a big blue box over the bottom half of my screen.  I use priority inbox and was told that this might be Gmail trying to refresh and paint the screen but something is getting messed up along the way.  

It's very hard to reproduce and the blue box typically only flashes for a fraction of a second so I haven't been able to get a screen grab of it.

Here's what I know:
It has something to do with the focus of the tab. 
If the tab is active, it only happens when I'm using gtalk within gmail. 
If the tab is inactive, it happens when I return to the tab. 
There seems to be something about how long the tab is inactive that triggers it.  If it's inactive for a few seconds it doesn't happen. 
It may have to do with Gmail trying to refresh or fetch new messages.  
Sometimes it's a blue box on the bottom half of the screen.
Sometimes it's a blue box across the whole email section.  
It's been happening for at least 3 months. Blizzard thought it might have started around the time Google+ showed up but I can't give an exact date. 
It happens 10-20 times per day depending on how frequently I'm switching between gmail and other app tabs. 
Gmail runs in an app tab for me. 

I run 3 add-ons:
Adblock Plus
Copy Short URL
Easy App Tab 

My plugins are up to date.
comments.author: melissashapiro1@gmail.com
